thread.section_title: FAU Owls Sports News - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Hutchinson, Jones lead Broward HOF inductees
thread.title_full: Hutchinson, Jones lead Broward HOF inductees - Sun Sentinel

author: Bryan Levine
title: Hutchinson, Jones lead Broward HOF inductees
text:
Former NFL standout Steve Hutchinson and NBA player Eddie Jones headline the Broward County Sports Hall of Fame's Class of 2015, Hall officials said in a release Thursday.
Hutchinson, a Coral Springs High alum, is arguably one of the best offensive linemen in Florida high school history. Named to the FHSAA all-century team in 2007, Hutchinson was a four-year starter at Michigan, playing for the Wolverines' 1997 national championship team, before being drafted 17 t h overall by the Seattle Seahawks in 2001.
Joining Hutchinson and Jones, a former Blanche Ely standout who the Los Angeles Lakers picked No. 10 overall in the 1994 NBA draft, in this year's inductees class are Lisa Zielinski, Marty Hendrick, Ryan Nelson Shealy and Charlie Partridge.
Jones, a three-time NBA All-Star, played 14 seasons in the NBA, including six with the Miami Heat.
Zielinski, of Coral Springs, serves as St. Thomas Aquinas' girls volleyball coach. The 28-year veteran coach has led the Raiders to 25 consecutive district titles and is approaching 700 career wins.
Eddie Jones TONY GUTIERREZ / ASSOCIATED PRESS Eddie Jones, a former Blanche Ely standout, played 14 seasons in the NBA, including six with the Miami Heat. He was a three-time NBA All-Star.
Eddie Jones, a former Blanche Ely standout, played 14 seasons in the NBA, including six with the Miami Heat. He was a three-time NBA All-Star.
(TONY GUTIERREZ / ASSOCIATED PRESS) Zielinski's teams have reached the regional finals 14 times, advancing in 10 times, and has won the Class 5A state title in three different decades (1995, 2004, 2014).
Partridge, a Plantation graduate and one of two FBS coaches hailing from Florida high schools, currently serves as football coach at Florida Atlantic.
Shealy, a Cardinal Gibbons alumnus, was an 11th-round MLB draft selection by the Colorado Rockies in 2002.
Hendrick, masters swim coach at Fort Lauderdale Aquatic Complex since 2005, has led 10 consecutive teams to top-10 National Championship finishes.
